intro: Dianthera angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dianthera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically violet or purple in color, with five petals arranged in a symmetrical pattern. Dianthera angustifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
